products.name: Mdify
products.tagline: One click away from turning any X Article into a clean knowledge base for your @openclaw agent
products.description: Stop pasting bloated links. Stop fighting bot protection. Stop wasting tokens on engagement fluff. Convert the post to clean .md with #Mdify → feed it directly to your agent → done

products.name: Guardskills
products.tagline: Safeguard your system environment by scanning AI skills for malicious code
products.description: Why risk your keys and credentials for installing malicious and unknow skills. Just use @guardskills_ and safeguard your system environment. It supports scanning skills.sh, GitHub, Clawhub, and local skills.

recentTweets.tweet: 80% of Fortune 500 now run active AI agents. The edge is no longer ‘who has AI’—it’s who has observability + governance + human-in-the-loop speed. We’re entering the Agent Operations era. Are you measuring agent ROI weekly yet?

AI agents fail on noisy pages. Mdify turns bloated articles into clean .md for your agent—fast, structured, scrape-free. Save tokens, skip JS render headaches. Try it: https://chromewebstore.google.com/detail/mdify/kimahdiiopfklhcciaiknnfcobamjeki #Mdify

engagementDrafts.reply: Adoption is accelerating fast. The next moat is agent observability + rollback discipline, not just model quality.
Great breakdown. Most teams underestimate evals + failure mode design. Agent UX starts with error handling.
Healthcare will reward teams that combine strict governance with narrow high-ROI workflows first.
This is the right framing: humans set intent and guardrails, agents execute and report.
Security-by-default agents will win enterprise trust faster than feature-heavy but opaque stacks.
Latency + interruption handling are the real UX killer features for voice agents right now.
Prompting didn’t die—its scope shifted from single prompts to system-level orchestration.
100%. Tool success rate and retry policy matter more than one benchmark screenshot.
Open source wins when teams can audit behavior, customize control planes, and ship faster loops.
Best metric I’ve seen: time-to-decision reduced per workflow, not just hours ‘saved’.
Voice support is compelling when it can summarize, cite sources, and handoff context cleanly to humans.

meta.notes: Brave/Exa search unavailable due to missing API key; used accessible public AI trend sources for topic selection and drafted engagement replies.
